Test your knowledge

Can you name this year's most commonly assigned summer reading books based off short plot synopses? Slide the bar to reveal the book cover.

“Education is mostly about institutions and getting tickets stamped; learning is what we do for ourselves. When we're lucky, they go together. If I had to choose, I'd take learning.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Denton ISD, Frisco ISD, Northwest ISD and at Arlington, Aubrey, Kennedale, Lake Dallas, Martin, Sanger and Woodrow Wilson high schools.

“Ralph wept for the end of innocence, the darkness of man's heart, and the fall through the air of the true, wise friend called Piggy.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Birdville ISD, Carroll ISD, Hurst-Euless-Bedford ISD and Northwest ISD and at The Episcopal School of Dallas, Hebron, Highland Park, North Mesquite and Woodrow Wilson high schools

“Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Denton ISD, Highland Park ISD and Richardson ISD and at Aubrey, Hebron, Highland Park, Lake Dallas and Lovejoy high schools

“There are a lot of children in Afghanistan, but little childhood.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Grand Prairie ISD and Mansfield ISD and at Newman Smith, Sunset, Wylie and Wylie East high schools

“Big Brother is Watching You.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Allen ISD, Coppell ISD and Little Elm ISD and at DeSoto, Flower Mound and Marcus high schools

“We realize the importance of our voices only when we are silenced.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Birdville ISD and Little Elm ISD and at The Episcopal School of Dallas, Lewisville, North Mesquite and Woodrow Wilson high schools

“Morality, it could be argued, represents the way that people would like the world to work, whereas economics represents how it actually does work.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Richardson ISD and at Brewer, DeSoto, Lake Dallas, St. Mark's School of Texas and Prestonwood Christian Academy

“There must be something in books, something we can’t imagine, to make a woman stay in a burning house; there must be something there. You don’t stay for nothing.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Birdville ISD and Coppell ISD and at Lake Dallas, North Mesquite and Singley Academy

"In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since. 'Whenever you feel like criticizing any one,' he told me, 'Just remember that all the people in the world haven't had the advantages that you've had.'"

Assigned by: All high schools in Allen ISD and Coppell ISD and at Singley Academy and Uplift North Hills

“Atticus told me to delete the adjectives and I'd have the facts.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Grand Prairie ISD and Argyle, Flower Mound and Marcus high schools

"Practice isn't the thing you do once you're good. It's the thing you do that makes you good."

Assigned by: All high schools in Allen ISD and at Argyle, Highland Park and Mansfield high schools

“All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Coppell ISD, Grand Prairie ISD and Richardson ISD and at Argyle High School

“People were always getting ready for tomorrow. I didn't believe in that. Tomorrow wasn't getting ready for them. It didn't even know they were there.”

Assigned by: All high schools in Birdville ISD and at Newman Smith, Wylie and Wylie East high schools

“I ought to be thy Adam, but I am rather the fallen angel…”

Assigned by: All high schools in Denton ISD and at The Episcopal School of Dallas and Prestonwood and Trinity Christian academies

“What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though.”

Assigned by: Brewer and Lewisville high schools, Singley Academy and Ursuline Academy of Dallas
